Posts.Content: Jul 15, 2009 06:03PM cnemeth wrote: My last chemo was the end of April and I have about 3/4" of hair all over.  Have been told that I look like Jamie Lee Curtis ~ more a reflection of the color than anything else.  The eyebrows are coming in similar to Andy Rooney ~ totally out of control.  Can't complain though, am just glad that they are coming in.  The eyelashes are coming in slowly ~ there are about 4 or 5 original ones that hung on. Can't decide if I want to bother with hair color anymore.  Will have to wait and see what I end up with. Does Tamoxifen affect your hair?!?
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jan 21, 2010 08:09PM cnemeth wrote: Lexislove ~ I totally feel your pain.  My right hand will get swollen for a few days and ache anytime I overdo it.  Have had lymphedema massage therapy and find that I constantly do self massage to keep things under control and keep myself aware of not overdoing it. Got about once a month to my favorite therapist (yes, she is $80/hour too) but monthly seems right for me.  It keeps me aware and the problem under control ~~ well so far anyway.  You never know with the LE. Take care,  Colleen
Posts.Title: Feeling a little Depressed...Mild Le. lexislove Suzybelle

Posts.Content: Oct 2, 2009 06:48AM cnemeth wrote: Everyone, I forgot to come back and let you know what happened.  My fingernails had all lifted and then they grew out and came back normal.  The moons and cuticles are like they were at the start ~~ Yahoo!! Colleen
Posts.Title: Fingernails ~ What is happening?? cnemeth cnemeth

Posts.Content: cnemeth wrote: My fingernails went crazy this last week, about a month after my last chemo (4 rounds T/C).  All during chemo they were incredibly healthy and strong.  Now they are still strong but appear to be lifting off of my nail bed.  The moons have turned into two white lines.  Very creepy looking. Has this happened to anyone??  Are they going to fall off??  It isn't like I can do anything about it but am wondering what will happen next. Definitely an interesting journey so far.  Preparing for double mast on 6/17 (right side lumpectomy and re-excision in December, still has bad margin) and trying to not worry about anything that I can't do something about.  Just discovered this site on Monday and marvel at the strength and compassion of so many fabulous women!!! Colleen Dx 11/3/2008, IDC, 1cm, Stage IIB, Grade 1, 1/14 nodes, ER+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Fingernails ~ What is happening?? cnemeth cnemeth

Posts.Content: Jul 26, 2009 08:10PM - edited Jul 26, 2009 08:10PM by cnemeth ang7 ~ My heart fell into my stomach when I read your post.  I had invasive DCIS and had a lumpectomy in December.  The margins came back bad and I had additional tissue removed.  Then found out in December that the margins were still bad and they thought the cancer was "skipping" through my duct. Fortunately (I guess you can call it that) my husband's oncologist (we had been seeing him for 5 years to deal with my husband's lymphoma) is the first person I had my primary care dr refer me to.  He said I was pulling the cart before the horse but agreed to the referral.  The oncologist who I trusted implicitly explained everything to me from start to finish and was involved with my surgeons decisions and plan of treatment.  There are surgeons out there with compassion (male and female) so find the right one. It is all about trusting your doctors (trust and verify) so you must find someone you trust. Colleen
Posts.Title: Feel like I am being jerked around... Ang7 SJW1
